choices.B: Explain to the recruiting manager that a project is temporary in nature, making it different than an operational environment.
choices.C: Develop relationship skills as a leader and also develop the teams' emotional intelligence skills.

questions.question_text:
An enthusiastic, newly hired vice-president has been assigned as the product owner for a digital transformation project. The project manager advises the product owner that some of the functional requirements are not aligned with the chief information technology officer's (CTO) strategy. The product owner tells the project manager that the CTO is not part of the project and should not be engaged at this moment.
What should the project manager do?

choices.A: Advise the CTO about the possible impacts caused by the project.
choices.C: Continue building the backlog since they are functional requirements.
choices.B: Influence the product owner to review the engagement needed from other stakeholders.
choices.D: Review the organizational process assets (OPAs) for historical information from similar projects.
